title: Captioning Assistant Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: You submit an application with a resume and cover letter. You are then admitted to an interview of about 10 questions with a board of people. The questions are sent to you beforehand so that you can prepare for the interview. Following this interview, you will receive an email about whether or not you got the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you think captioning is important for students that need it?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview notification last week, and I attended it. The interview is good, not too hard, everyone is nice. the questions are intense, but it was just common normal questions. I am waiting for results now.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your free time.

title: Instructor Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Overall is was a great interview! The interview was about an hour long and with a panel. I really enjoyed that they let me review the questions 15 minutes prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: When was a time you worked with a difficult stakeholder or SME?

title: Research Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Very impersonal zoom interview where a five-person committee read scripted questions at me. Standard broad and generic interview questions but slightly adapted to fit the particular position. Overall a very impersonal and uncomfortable process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What do you see as the biggest issue facing this particular department? Tell me about a time you failed?

title: Website Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Meet briefly with a small panel of stakeholders to discuss my experience with the managing software, roles, and responsibilities. Interview was mostly personal questions with some technical aspects mixed in
Interview Questions: How long have you worked with WordPress

title: Student Mentor Undergrad Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of interviews with very kind staff members. Also went through a group interaction process to see how the rest of the team would interact with one another. I was also asked to explain how my history would benefit me and the students I would be mentoring in the position.
Interview Questions: Please explain how you would help a student in need?

title: HR Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was not told ahead of time who I would be interviewing with. I naively assumed it was the person that originally contacted me. To my surprise there were 4 interviewers.  They were very specific with me and said I would definitely hear something by the end of the following week, whether I was moving forward or not. No one ever got back with me. I get it. Everyone is busy. But, don't tell a candidate that if you don't think you can follow through with what you said.
Interview Questions: Basic HR-related/situational interview questions were asked.

title: User Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions:
Standard behavioral questions, both with hiring managers and HR. Great place to work. 

They will invite you to campus with a parking pass for interview, then proceed with the 1-4 hour process.
Interview Questions: List a time when you had to overcome a difficult situation?

title: Student Dining Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the University of California Santa Cruz employment system and got an interview a couple of days later. The interview was pretty basic with simple questions, such as "Tell me about yourself".
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the dining hall?

title: Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process dragged out over about two months and had 3 interviews, which included 2 Zoom interviews and 1 onsite interview. I found the amount of time it took to make a decision by management caused unnecessary stress upon the applicant.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you hate to do at your job?

title: Technical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the unit admin with generic content, I had been selected to interview for the position - time options - after some back and forth, a zoom invite was sent and I was told I'd receive the interview questions 24 hours before my interview so that I would have time to prepare. This is standard, as far as I know, across the university.
Interview Questions: 10 total, including a presentation.

title: Social Sciences Computing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application that I filled out and submitted. Then I had an in-person interview with the hiring manager. After that I was extended a part-time offer as a computing assistant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a computing assistant

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Two Zoom Interviews.
The first interview was with 3 interviewers asking 9 questions that took up about 45 minutes. 
The second interview was with the same 3 interviewers but instead started with my giving a 5 minute presentation and then was followed by another 5 questions.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time when you... (Many of these types of questions)

title: Housing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Archaic keyword game, 5 panelists interview for an entry-level position. Most interviewers were condescending and distracted. You will get the job if you drop a word salad spiel of job description keywords. Don't stress; just google keyword interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: It was fine they asked about my life and how I would fit in the role at the school of university of California Santa Cruz so I said yes to their offer to become an intern for their school
Interview Questions: Not many questions were asked

title: Content Creation Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: First, I  had a telephone interview that lasted about thirty minutes and included basic "about me" questions. Next, I went in for a panel interview with four individuals, which was lengthy (approx. 45 min) but friendly. Additionally, I sent in a portfolio of previous work.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you faced difficulty or disagreement in the work place. How did you handle it. What do you see as your strengths and weaknesses in this area?

title: Building Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was basic interview soft questions. There were 30 other interviewees in the zoom call with the interviewer. We had to raise hands to answer the question then get picked on.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness, then strength.

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews conducted over zoom, the first one asking about my previous work and gauging the understanding in it, second was technical and asked regarding the project topic.
Interview Questions: Which are the current SOTA 3D point cloud backbone models and why are they not as efficient as their 2D counterparts?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of one zoom call that lasted for one hour. There were 4 people on the interview committee who all took turns asking questions. General interview questions asked as well as a few specific situational questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about one of your weaknesses.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I first met with a 3-person search committee. The questions were prepared and all applicants were given the same questions. The second part of the interview consisted of a one-hour open question session with the department stakeholders. The third part of the interview was an exit interview with the director of the program. People were very friendly and passionate about the program.
Interview Questions: Have you ever seen a budget spreadsheet like this before (sample was provided).

title: Undergraduate Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: An online interview / conversation with a professor, It was about ten to fifteen minutes, no technical question was asked, but then the position was mainly on reading research papers.
Interview Questions: none, just asked why I wanted to apply and what am I interested in.

title: Student Dining Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Easy just a skype interview, just act normal and if you have at least some experience with cooking they will hire you. Also make sure you talk about being safe and clean while cooking.
Interview Questions: How do you make sure you are safe when cooking?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: A brief interview to get to know who I am and what I am looking for in the future. They met with me in person and had a sit-down interview highlighting what they are looking for in an intern and seeing if I could meet those requirements.
Interview Questions: What are some of my interests in the area?

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. They ask behavioral questions to gauge what type of person you are. The person interviewing me was very welcoming and it made the interview feel more like a conversation. The interview lasted at most 30 minutes
Interview Questions: What would you do if you couldn't make it to work on time.

title: College Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I applied online by using the ER system and the advisor sent me an email to schedule an interview with her and a returning peer advisor. She emailed me some questions to prepare and asked the exact same questions during the interview. They interviewed a lot of candidates with two open position.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the Peer Adviser Position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Great interview experience. Very inviting and welcoming. They asked me questions about my future career plans and sounded very invested in helping me get where I wanted to be. Overall an eight out of ten experience
Interview Questions: What are your 5 year plans

title: Dining Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't much of an interview. I simply filled out the form required and brought to the office where the manager looked over my form, asked me a few basic questions such as availability.
Interview Questions: Can you work a minimum of three shifts per week?

title: LSS Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview where the interviewer asked a multitude of questions wondering how the interviewee would respond to different classroom situations. Many of the questions were about reacting different in class situations.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student who is shy?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview with three individuals from the department. The interview consisted of multiple questions on campus. The department manager, graduate advisor, and another undergraduate advisor participated in the process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you managed to help a difficult customer

title: Frontline Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled you into an interview and had two staff members ask you standard interview questions. Got an email back a week later and you do an orientation around the office.
Interview Questions: Not questions by verbatum but along the lines of: what experience do you have that is relevant to the job?

title: Ethics and Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked personality questions such as, the challenges I faced and why I'm interested to work in that position, how many languages I speak and a little bit of coding and data structure
Interview Questions: How are you going to be impactful in a rule you applied for? what makes you a more eligible applicant compare to the other people we interview.

title: Maintenance Crew Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I met with my manager and overall Maintenance Supervisor. They asked questions about my previous construction experience. It took about an hour. There were back to back interviews. My friend got a job there first and then referred me.
Interview Questions: What is your current major?

title: College Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very helpful and not too difficult. When I came in for an interview, they gave us a list of questions that would potentially be asked and we had time to prepare and think about our answers before the interview. I was interviewed by current advisors that I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficulty that you faced? How did you overcome it?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Once invited for an interview into the graduate program I was invited to spend 3 days visiting the campus, students, and professors. Over the course of these 3 days you will get to hear short presentations from professors and students regarding their research. This is a great opportunity to ask questions about their science and what their future directions and projects are. During the interview itself, be expected to discuss your previous research experience in depth. To keep the focus off of yourself, I would recommend asking the professor questions about their research, their field, and how they enjoy the campus and work environment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research experience?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Different departments have different processes. Mine was for LSS. No phone screening.  I submitted an application online and was hired for the following academic year.  They gave me 15 minutes to review the questions before I started.
Interview Questions: Scenario question of how I would prioritize tasks.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: pretty standard. first you submit your app to the career center, then you get an interview from the org you plan on working for in april and decisions are made in may.
Interview Questions: describe a time when you had conflict with someone

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer asked me about my job experience. Also, we talked about my aspirations and skills. It was short-- did not last more than 30 minutes. The person who interviewed me was quite friendly and down-to-earth.
Interview Questions: What did I do at my last job? Explain my responsibilities.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an interview appointment about two weeks later. Two people, they only asked a few questions (about five or six), it lasted about 30 minutes, overall very chill!
Interview Questions: "What three words would you use to describe yourself with?", "How would your friends describe you?", "Why do you want this position?", "Describe your prior work experience"...

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a postdoc position. I was invited for an interview via Skype with the head of the research group. I gave a presentation of my portfolio showing details of my previous projects in consultancy and research.
Interview Questions: General questions about my research and development background.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: its not that much difficult you can easily pass once you are good in you subject please reed the books and article. so its become easy to qualify interview best wishesh
Interview Questions: Its related to your subject

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was open, friendly, and fun! The women working there were calm and easy to talk to. A very pleasant experience! They provided important questions and gave adequate time to think and respond. They built on what they learned about me to ask specific questions.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a situation in which many things were demanded of you at once?

title: Senior Class Council Co Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightdforward. First an email scheduling a meeting. And then the meeting was done through Google Hangouts since we were not in the city at the time. The video chat interview did not take a very long time, about 20 minutes total. After, I waited about 3 days for them to call me back.
Interview Questions: How can you used what you've learned, through other jobs and school, to fill this position?

title: Technical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was brought into a room with 6 people in it. Turns out some of the people would be my colleagues. At first glance that may seem appropriate. But when a subordinate colleague determines your hiring, they have an air of superiority after hire. Not a good management decision. They take turns asking you pre-determined questions, reading off a piece of paper. Very sterile and odd.
Interview Questions: Technical basics, experience

title: Mailroom Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview with the manager for 10-15 min. They got back to me in a week if I got the offer or not. Since it is for a part-time position, they do not ask any technical questions
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: 15 Minute interview. Easy questions. Mostly basic questions that would force you talk.  Interview with two current student managers. Get given information about the company and the fact that there is a probationary period.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about ResNet

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Only one phone interview. I applied to the professor via Email to work with her and my portfolio was matching to her requirements so she checked it and called me for an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work.

title: Library Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Called in for interview and was asked for previous experience. The whole interview took about 20 minutes and you just have to demonstrate that you're friendly and capable of dealing with people.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Clara, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: They were very professional, but upfront about the interview process. For example, they informed me that they had 2 other candidates to interview. I had 2 interviews there, one lasted 2.5 hours and the other 3.5 hours. The length of time depends on how many team members are on the team you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Describe our sequencing system

title: 911 Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: submitted application, had a personal health questionnaire, interview, extensive background check was required.  I also had to take a pre-qualifying test and sit along with a current dispatcher.  The background check took 3 months to complete, it was very extensive.
Interview Questions: priorities, customer service

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 on 1 interview that lasted an hour, which included a mock 5 minute presentation to high schoolers that was at the end. About 10 questions which they let me review 15 minutes before the interview. Interview was round robin style. Formal, polite, one of the interviewers was really friendly while the other two were intimidating. Took way too long to hear about an offer, about a month. Was a temporary position.
Interview Questions: What was something that went wrong and how did you deal with it?

title: Reader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview process. A former upper-division professor of mine asked me to work for them. I was summoned because I did extremely well in their class.
Interview Questions: Would you like to work for me?

title: IT Support Specialist Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and concise. Interview took around 15-20 minutes. All questions were focused on personality. A 2 panel group interviews you while switching off asking questions. Both are observing you and writing down your answers.
Interview Questions: What do we do here at ResNet?

title: Mailroom Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the school's job system for a work-study position, received an email inquiry within the same week to schedule my interview. After I had scheduled for my interview, the questions were pretty basic questions that are common for any other interview. Since it required dealing with many student's personal information/packages, they had informed me that the position requires someone who is detailed oriented, well-organized, and self-motivated since the work shift will be by myself.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Kind interviewers and lots os back and forth conversation. Yep way street. But it'd took them so ooooo long to followed up after interview. Entire process well over 3 months.
Interview Questions: Tell about one time you had conflict with a CIO worker asked how you worked it out.

title: Student Laboratory Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I came across the position when my professor announced it after a lecture. He told us pick up and application from the PI's office and drop it off in the box outside her door.  A week after she contacted me via email to set up a phone interview.  I had a 15 minute phone interview with the PI and the we scheduled an in person interview.
Interview Questions: What is your past work experience and how will it help you in this position?

title: UCSC Student Food Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: paper application followed by an in person interview. The in person interview followed the questions bellow. The hiring manager will skim over the paper application then will proceed with an interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
What is your schedule like?
Can you lift heavy things up 30 lbs?
will you be able to work during weekends and mornings?
You will be required to work during finals weekend will that be alright with you?

title: LSS Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was given a sample essay to read through for 15 minutes, and then asked to role play as though I was in a tutorial with a tutee. The interviewer then asked about my availability, etc., as well as other subjects I would be willing to tutor.
Interview Questions:
What does it mean to you to work with a diverse range of students? 
What advice would you give to a student with this paper? What would you focus on? 
How does your experience make you qualified for this position?

title: Support Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was brought into the Help Desk and interviewed by the manager and the person who would be my boss. They asked technical questions like what I would do if a person was having a problem logging into google accounts etc....
Interview Questions: A person can't access their computer, what do you do?

title: University Relations Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very straight forward, asked questions regarding using multi lined phone systems, professional environment experience, phone etiquette, assisting people in person as well as via the phone, directing phone traffic to its respective recipients etc. The interview concluded with a tour of the office, introducing me to various people throughout the department. Everything was on time and orderly. Seemed like a very efficient, productive, and positive working environment.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with difficult people in work environments in the past?

title: Assistant Food Service Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a group of interviewers comprised of Admin, Unit Mgrs, and other managerial staff, and me. They had a series of questions listed on a sheet of paper that they handed me and each had themselves. They started at number one and proceeded to ask me each question one by one as they went around the table.
Interview Questions: Tell us your experience in food service management.

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: After applying through the ER system, I received an email saying there would be a phone interview scheduled. After a week of waiting for a followup and calling a couple times, there was finally a phone interview. The interview itself was casual with two interviewers on the line. They asked about how my previous jobs would help in this setting, and the like. They also kept it laid back asking questions like what would my ideal super power be if I had one. Overall, the interviewers made me feel welcome to open up, and almost goof around a little bit (which is a sense of what the atmosphere is actually like).
Interview Questions: Typical background check and compatibility questions.

title: International Education Office- Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Resume, cover letter and application questions followed by a 45 minute interview over Skype. The interview was more serious than the actual job was and was one of the most rigorous interviews I've ever had. The interviewers asked about my time abroad as well as my technical skills and scenario questions. I got the job and it was followed by a three day intensive training.
Interview Questions: How would you assist a student that had no idea where they wanted to go abroad except that they knew they wanted to go abroad?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was well organized once it started, but was very off put by a VERY long wait.  I had applied to the position 5 months before I ever heard anything back.  Panel was well balanced and questions were give in advance.
Interview Questions: How I keep myself organized.

title: Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel consisting of two managers and a supervisor in the department I was looking to work for.  The process took about 45 minutes to an hour.
Interview Questions: How do I handle an environment where issues and problems pertaining to confidential information arise fairly rapidly.

title: Senior Maintenance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Prior knowledge of maintenance processes are 100% required. Previous experience within the UCSC maintenance team is also required, preferably in the area of 1 or 2 years. The interview revolves primarily around how you would operate a team. There are typically a few managers who you have operated under below and they are the ones asking you sets of questions to see if you are a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: If one of your students were a good friend but had repeated absences, how would you handle their absenteeism?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There are behavioral and technical questions. Know yourself and your experiences so you can talk about it in the interview. Interviewers are very nice, and they are on your side, so no need to worry about how you will do. You can do it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held in three parts. I spent about 30 minutes being interviewed a set of formatted questions by the search committee which included the Director and two others. The second part of the interview consisted of open-ended questions from the department staff and volunteers which lasted about one hour. The last part of the interview consisted of a short de-brief with the Director.
Interview Questions: They asked me what my management style was like.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview glossed my experience teaching undergraduates; e.g., what classes have you taught, what instructional approaches do you take, what would you do if a student presented you with X situation, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your university teaching experience.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed by on-campus interviews with multiple faculty members in one weekend; relaxed schedule for the interview; laid back and friendly environment; lots of opportunities for mingling and informal chat; beautiful campus
Interview Questions: All were standard questions, ability to briefly and clearly explain your previous research experience is obviously a big plus.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked me for my resume/CV and asked what courses I had taught before. I said "this, this, and this." They said, "Cool. Well I know that Professor X has had you before and, oh, you know one of my friends from this university. So yeah, I think you will work out well."
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach this course?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application. Was offered to come to visit day after given an offer. Visit day was great, so I accepted the offer. I am happy with my advisors and the application process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions:
Went in for one interview. Pretty straight forward Qs. Talked about my experience abroad and that complexity of living in a different country. 

They wanted to be sure you were responsible and took your job seriously.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you have students smoking in dorm rooms?

title: Mailroom Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: you would need to get a good looking resume and the process would take about a day and then she will call you to meet her at a certain place.
Interview Questions: it isnt any difficult question

title: Outrech Caller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they got back to me within a week, which I was surprised about. We had phone interviews set up. I did not get the job though, because they were looking for people to work in the month I was not in town. She asked pretty basic questions.
Interview Questions: It was nothing unexpected

title: Course Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Professor the class teaching it the first quarter. It was just reviewing my course progress and knowledge, nothing hard, just making sure I was adept for the job.
Interview Questions: Did you take CMPS 12A? If so what did you receive in it?

title: Maintenance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: A casual conversation, really tries to get to know you. The dress code is not specified but business casual is always a go to if not for a position like this. There may or not be another student worker there to ask you questions as well so do not prepare any butt-kissing answers. They are looking for real personality not generic answers.
Interview Questions: Surpringsingly casual

title: Senior Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: nothing to disclose here- it was long and arduous and had nothing whatsoever  to do with the quality of the programming after the hire fact. Good questions tpo not mean it is a good place to work.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: FIlm Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: They will test you on your technical aptitude in film. They will ask you about your film experience. They will ask you behavioral questions that attempt to verify your integrity. The process was easy I got hired two days after which was awesome.
Interview Questions: What is your film experience. Name these peices of equipment.

title: PA IV - Unix Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Long, difficult slog to get to the interview process at all; you have to get materials ... all materials... in by the Initial Review Data on the jobs.ucsc.edu website.  If you miss this date, you might as well have not applied.  Interviews were doled out by committee 6 weeks after the initial review date.. interviews are by committee with pre-printed questions.  State law prevents a lot of testing or re-assessment.. if you're close to the exact qualifications on the job description, you have a shot, but if you aren't, state law prevents a hire, so make sure you're well-versed enough to be able to talk the talk.  If you do get in, it's easy to fake it til you make it though.  There's a lot of incompetence on the hoof there, so if you're lacking in an area, you won't look bad as long as  you resolve it swiftly.
Interview Questions: There weren't really difficult or unexpected questions, which made the process odd.  The questions are designed by committee, and there aren't a lot of hard hitters.  Some "have you memorized commands" things, and on interviews involving coding issues, sometimes a chunk of code to interpret, but this shouldn't be difficult or unexpected for that type of job interview.

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line after seeing the job posting on the school's ER System. Interview was relatively straightforward. Asked some simple technical questions along with some behavioral questions. Heard back with an offer in about at week.
Interview Questions: Describe the difference between RAM and Hard Disk Storage

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well organized. There was an online application along with in person interview with a panel of two people who had skills ranging from technology and leadership. These interviews were led by other students who were currently working there.
Interview Questions: What kind of technologies have you worked with? What leadership experience do you have?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the university career site and received a call for interview. I was interviewed by all the programmers and the supervisor. I answered basic programming questions in languages of your choice and was tested for my ability to communicate ideas. I was evaluated against several other candidates and two people were hired including myself.
Interview Questions: I have not learned networks programming and simply answered based on intuition. This is an important part of the job.

title: Student Dining Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied and interview phone interview set up. Asked 6 questions and was offered job in same phone call
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult customer

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager contacted me a few months after I applied. The interviewer was very friendly and welcoming. Did not stray from the typical questions asked during interviews for this type of position. Short and a little boring.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What is your biggest weakness? etc.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process at the University takes a while because of fair hiring practices. Just remember that the questions they ask you are the questions they HAVE to ask all the candidates, so sometimes they are repetitive or not applicable. Everyone you interview with takes notes, so be sure to give detailed answers with examples!
Interview Questions: Questions weren't too difficult, but the toughest would be " Give an example of a staff issue you have had in the past with a coworker or manager and how it was solved?"

title: Intramural Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Questions were asked through email then I was hired conditionally and evaluated after on site observations. There were five questions asking about my academic standings, prior experience, and how I would assess my leadership and sports knowledge.
Interview Questions: Prior experience

title: Programmer Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz
Interview Descriptions: Got and interview.  20 questions over an hour, most were softballs.  Took three months tho.
Interview Questions: Describe a technical problem you were unable to fix.

title: Special Collections Archive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy, very straightforward. What they look to target is your skill at data management, which is an extremely large part of the job. This is a job where emphasis is put on working with people in a front desk atmosphere as well as working with the inter library staff. A passion for books as well as a knowledge of the collection is essential if you want an assured hire.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to Special Collections? How are you with data collection?

title: Programmer Analyst IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Mountain View, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very brief phone screen, followed by all-day onsite.  Interviews with multiple NASA and UCSC engineers, programmers, and scientists.  White board coding problems in C and Java.  White board problems in computational geometry and questions on system design.  Security form (questions about recent jobs, places of residence, and contacts) that took a couple of weeks to evaluate.  Follow-up with HR and 2 senior managers.
Interview Questions: How would you design a system to detect weather issues and re-route aircraft around them

title: Dining Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Well, I came in a few minutes early but the person who was going to do my interview was really busy. When she came in, we did the interview in the dining hall. she asked me the general questions people usually ask, mostly about how you deal with co-workers who dont get along or those who you dont get along with. At the end, she told me that they were looking to hire 5 to six people.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult situation with co-workers

title: Library Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good. Received a quick call asking me to come in. When I went in, I was ust asked basic questions to get to know you and what your past experiences were. It was very causal conversation to get to know each other.
Interview Questions:
What are past experiences and how will these experiences reflect to the job you're applying for?
What are you studying currently in college?
How do you handle these tasks with patrons?
It was very causal conversation to get to know each other.

title: Learning Technologiy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, NM) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. On site interview, lasted about 30 minutes. Did it with 2 other staff members. Lots of questions about your past experiences with video and audio kind of technology.
Interview Questions: What software did you use?

title: ChancellorsProgram Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Long process. You apply in February but you don't get interviews until March (end of March). And you hear back if you were chosen in May. 
Make sure you have all your documents in before the deadline, technology is hanky! Your application can get denied because a professor forgot to send a letter of rec.
Applications are released in January, Start early!
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose this internship?
Career goals?
Strengths/weaknesses?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was through the admission process by submitting applications through the system and communicating with professors. No special interview or question before the admission. The professor decides based on their availability and budget.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest

title: Summer Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Apply using the employee request system online, make sure to apply early
Most of the interview focuses on getting to know you, they understand that it might be your first job. Pretty much you just sit in a room and talk to two people about yourself and why you like UCSC
Interview Questions: Personal questions

title: MCD Department Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Email response slow. Scheduled a time for me to come in to the lab. Asked about resume and interview q's. Then showed me the lab and introduced me to lab members.
Interview Questions: Asked about how a cell works. Asked about prior internships. Why did I choose this lab.

title: Summer Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pointed questions that allow for well articulated responses that reveal the interviewee's core values. The process is fair, but rigorous. One must go into the panel interview having prepared statements which showcase an outgoing personality, ability to follow directions, and love for the campus and it's values.
Interview Questions: What have you been involved with on campus and how would that knowledge benefit an incoming transfer or frosh student?

title: Maintenance Crew Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three people were there to be interviewed, and three people were there to do the interviewing. They would alternate in asking us questions. We weren't told on the spot if we would be considered for the job but those of us that were received phone calls immediately after. Straightforward questions about past experience and plans for the future. Also about what we want to learn during our time working there. The three people there to interview us were the two main supervisors that we would interact with on a daily basis and the head supervisor. He was a very cool guy and I still keep in touch with whenever I have a question to ask. I had been referred to this job so they asked me how I knew this person.
Interview Questions: What construction experience do you have?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. Felt comfortable with the person who interviewed. Mainly asked questions in regards to personality and how you would fit into the systems and jobs that are in place. Overall it was a pretty good experience.
Interview Questions: How many marbles can fit in a hat?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submit cover letter,resume, and internal application.  Group interview with 3 to 5 people. Sometimes a phone interview to screen out before the in-person interview. Some interviews can happen via videoconference.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were specifically related to the qualifications, which were known to me ahead of time. There wasn't anything unexpected or difficult. If you prepare answers related to the qualifications, the interview goes well.

title: STEM Career Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Their were two interviews, one by phone and another in person.  The phone call consisted of three interviewers.  The second interview was with a group of ~10 individuals.  The in-person interview was over an hour and I had to present a 15 minute presentation on whatever topic I wanted.
Interview Questions:
What experience did I have working with students?
Scenario questions (i.e. student comes to your office with this problem..how would you advise them)

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: They have group interviews. Very general questions about how you would deal with a customer or someone who came in.  Be enthusiastic and confident.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you received or gave great customer service.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward. I was asked to give my specific experience with a number of skills ahead of time. I was also given questions up front so that I could consider my answers. As far as I know, this is rather uncommon practice at UCSC for this type of position. Everyone was very friendly and I got excellent feedback after the interview. They were clear about when they would get back to me, and they followed through.
Interview Questions: I had the questions ahead of time, so there wasn't really anything unexpected. I don't recall any of the specific questions or any of them being particularly difficult. I always dislike the question about a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview based on resume and asked situations about how to react and get through potential problems
Interview Questions: How would you help a student who has no interest in studying

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with a panel, second was one on one. After that, it was a relatively short wait, about a week, before I got an informal offer. The formal offer took two more weeks to come through.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you came up with a business solution.

title: FITC Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: After applying through the ER system, I was called in to do an interview. Many of the job requirements that were asked for were surprisingly not asking for solid information or paper-work, indicating that this was a entry-level job. Although it was not too difficult to apply and put word to paper, many of the questions asked by the interviewer involved the requirements that were listed prior, such as "Do you have experience in assisting people?", or "Do you have experience using Adobe Products and/or Microsoft Office and/or several OS's, such as Linux, Windows, or Mac OS?"
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in ...

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had a group activity with other prospective RAs. Then invited to be interviewed by a supervisor and a current Residential Assistant. The 1:1 interview were about 20 minutes. The whole process was fairly easy going and not that stressful. I think the whole waiting part after the interview to a job offer was more stressful to be honest!
Interview Questions: If your friend did something against our residential policies, what would you do?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The position was advertised around campus early January and deadlines to apply were late January. First round interviews were group interviews where we had to present a one minute project on any topic to a group of our peers, participate in team building exercises, and talk to management. Second rounds were two on one behavioral interviews.
Interview Questions: Applicants were emailed a list of potential questions so preparation was simply a matter of putting in the work and figuring out your answers.

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, but enjoyable! First, one must pass a paper application review out of about 80+ applicants. Then, a group interview is conducted, in which 40-50 remaining applicants are observed while performing team-building exercises. Finally, participants are narrowed down to about 20 in number and are too interview one-on-one with Residential Life Staff or Academic Staff and a former RA with experience with the position. If one passes this, they will finally be selected to be a part of the Residential Life team, consisting of about 7-10 continuing/experienced RAs and 7-10 newly-selected RAs. This is how the process took place at Crown College, UCSC for the selection of the 2010-2011 ResLife Staff.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a potentially violent or dangerous situation?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was already working there, and the description of the position was catered to myself.
Interview Questions: n/a

title: Academic Advising Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: After applying online you will probably only get a response if they pick you for an interview - no surprise there. They do have a application/career online portal where you can see the status of jobs you've applied to, however. This online portal is only updated by HR and will reflect whether or not you've been picked for an interview, etc. You'll probably find out via direct contact if you've been picked before you'd ever see it online. If you're picked for an interview, you'll get a call or an email to come in for a panel interview. Very standard panel interview. The managers/the people who will be above you (if you get the position) typically hold the interview and they can choose whomever they please to be on the panel as well. Additionally, they can choose their own questions to ask you. They are more behavioral/experience questions. Not a difficult interview. Sometimes they hold 2 or more rounds of interviews as well. I worked there and conducted interviews as well as being interviewed there...
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you resolved it.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Santa Cruz, CA) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Application was online with standard resume uploaded. The wait before the interview was about 1 month. Ten people were interviewed for the position. I think I got the job because of letters of reference and prior work experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working with difficult personalities.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz (Mountain View, CA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Initially there was a phone interview.  About a week or two later I met with 5 members of the company for about 1 hour each in separate interviews.  A week later, I had a follow up interview with another member of the company.
Interview Questions: Describe an algorithm for sorting a list of numbers.

title: Database Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Santa Cruz in Jun 2007
Interview Descriptions: Found the job posting through Craigslist and interviewed with a staffing agency, who then referred me to the main employer for the one-on-one interview.  Came in the following day and interviewed with the supervisor at the job site and was asked to come in to work a few days later because they were shorthanded.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?
